data.title: A trusted favorite
data.text: I've been coming here from years and I always recommend it to visitors. The food remains consistently delicious. The yellow curry is a personal favorite. I love me some Thai Tea as well.

data.title: Lousy
data.text: Bathroom without working lock and no soap -- despite sign that tells workers to wash their hands. Worst Thai food I've had in a long time. Plus the food was almost cold when it arrived.

data.title: Always a good choice!
data.text: The service, food and atmosphere can't be beat.  The food never disappoints and the servers are always ready to answer questions about the menu.  The quality of the food has never disappointed us. Their variety is nice too.  The dining room is always clean and there is an option for outside seating.

data.title: Best Pad See Won!
data.text: Vegan friendly. Little pricey. But amazing thai food! And they have sushi as well! Always a plus! Def recommend.

data.title: Love this place
data.text: We have eaten at Taste of Thai for years and have NEVER had a bad experience.  We can get in and the ambiance is delightful.  The food is amazing and the stuff is pleasant and helpful.  I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone.

data.title: Try it out
data.text: Food was very good. We started with the steamed pork dumplings which were great and I ordered the kang pa nang curry with tofu. Curry was great, I chose the level 3 heat, could have been hotter, so if you like hot don't be afraid to spice it up. Waitress was very helpful and decor was fitting for a Thai restaurant. If the weather is nice they also have a patio to enjoy.

data.title: Highly disappointed
data.text:
We arrived here shortly after 12:00 pm. They did not appear excessively busy. After being seated inside,  we decided to sit on the patio. We let our waiter know and he said fine, I will be with you momentarily.  After waiting about 15 minutes, we asked another waiter to let our guy know we were ready.

The 2nd waiter took our order and brought salads and shortly thereafter water. Worst water ever, but he said people from Fayetteville were used to it.  After waiting an additional full hour, we gave up and left.

We watched another party of 3 give up also. They changed their menu to take out and they were never brought their food.

I understand when things get behind in the kitchen,  but don't make promises that your food will be here shortly.

data.title: Really great food and outside patio
data.text: Wow this was my first time but will return for more. The atmosphere is neat. Staff is great, helpful and friendly. Food is really REALLY good. Can't go wrong with any choice off menu. My level of heat was a 3 and it was perfect.

data.title: Yellow Curry
data.text: Once you find something you like at any given restaurant, you seem to always get the same item, with me it is the Yellow Curry at Taste of Thai.

data.title: Amazing Thai!
data.text: A Taste of Thai is located in a building off the square that used to house a law firm I used to work for back in the day.  And, frankly, the space is being put to much better use now.  NWA is home to a number of wonderful Thai restaurants, but this is my favorite.  Always very clean and comfortable, service is attentive and friendly, and the food is amazing.  And if you're a fan of hot-n-spicy, they'll turn up the temperature to whatever your taste.  You can never go wrong here!

data.title: Nice Place, Great Outside Patio
data.text: I loved eating on the outside patio.  The service was great as usual.  I come here whenever I'm in town.  The food is good but not great.  If you want Thai, this is a good place to eat.

data.title: Great Thai food at a reasonable price
data.text: Centrally located. Great tasting food that doesn't break the bank. Promo service. Clean and courteous. The Yum Nur was the best I ever tasted and beef portions were very generous. I'll be visiting this place each evening during my stay here. It's that good.

data.title: Our Favorite Thai Food in Northwest Arkansas!
data.text: We love Thai food, and we used to live in cities where it was common.  Now, we are delighted to be discovering some excellent Thai food in Arkansas.  This place does a great job with its curries and its noodle dishes.  The Tom Yum is classic!  Their idea of hot agrees with mine, which made my order come out with just the right amount of spiciness.  The location is just off the historic square in downtown Fayetteville, walkable from the Dickson Street strip, if you're out partying.  If you like Thai, you're going to love this restaurant!

data.title: little place with big taste
data.text: I have only been here once but I want to go back again.  This is a great place and it is worth the time to go there.

data.title: Great dinner
data.text:
What a w'derful place coconut shrimp so good and 6 pieces to an order. Wine list was nice and but not expensive. They also have several by the glass. We had a chicken curry that was delicious and plenty of sticky rice. My husband and I shared everything and were stuffed!  
Wine.    $22.00
Shrimp $  6.00 ish
Entree. $11.95
_________________
               $39.95 total
If I didn't say its dntw Fayetteville just around the corner from The Chancellor Hotel

data.title: Fantastic!
data.text: The food is always perfect. Love this place. Don is always so respectful. and he never forgets a face.

data.title: Cheap skates
data.text: You would think for the price of a $20 delivered entree, they might throw in 4 or 5 fried wontons, but NO, not this place.

data.title: Gem
data.text: Great little place. Went based off reviews and were not disappointed. Friendly servers and clean place. Yellow curry was great as was the pad Thai.

data.title: Delicious Lunch!
data.text: This little restaurant tucked in a side street off Fayetteville downtown square offers a great menu and our meals were all delicious! Nice, relaxing atmosphere, pleasant service, and many choices on the menu. You can have a glass of wine or cold beer if you like to order your dish very spicy! I went middle of the road and my dish was perfect! I will definitely visit again!

data.title: Excellent food and great service!
data.text:
The restaurant is conveniently located close to downtown Fayetteville with plenty of parking on the street outside. The locale is not flashy or upscale but it was nice and clean despite the time of night (we got in there late, around 9:30PM). 

The service was great and our waiter, Travis, was wonderful. Not only was he friendly and easy to talk to, he was also fast and efficient. On top of that he also recommended a dish for my wife that she absolutely loved. 

The food was really really good. In fact, it was some of the best Asian food I've had in a long time. I had sweet & sour chicken, which was different to what I was used to, but very good none the less. My wife had a dish I can't remember the name of, but it had chicken and soft rice noodles and a delicious sauce. Both were excellent meals and there was so much food that we had to bring almost half of it with us home, despite being quite hungry.

Recommended!
